Usama Mahmood

I am a Front-End developer, who knows his way around the backend as well. I am constantly learning newer technologies and at the same time polishing the skills I have already acquired. I am a hardworking and passionate person looking forward to new and meaningful experiences in my field. Please have a look at my resume.

SKILLS


HTML, the backbone of web development. My initial learing for this was in University with a basic course and later I improved with the help of FreeCodeCamp.

CSS is what adds life to a website. My initial learning for this was through a course in University and later on I improved my skills with a course from udemy. My project Optimal Housing reflects my CSS SKILLS.

Javascript is what makes a page dynamic. My initial learning for this language was in University later on I took an elaborate course on udemy to learn ES6, webpack and babel. My project Tracalorie is one of my favourite projects as it reflects my skills of vanilla javascript.

React is one of the most popular framework. I am mastering this language and will soon come up with some exciting projects.

I just love sass. It makes writing css much more fun and easy. I learned it through udemy and I have have been using it ever since for my basic front-end projects. This Designer Portfolio template was made with the help of sass.

bootstrap is a very handy framework, I learned it while making javascript projects because my main focus was to learn ES6 and I used this framework to quickly prototype my UI.

PHP and MySQL go hand in hand. I learned these two language throughout my university and my Final Year Project shows my ability to use these two language to create a full stack app.

I am using npm and git in almost all the projects. Using npm to install the dependencies and git to push my code to github.

I know my way around both Adobe Illustrator and adobe photoshop. I picked up these skills during my recent job at costa coffe. My portfolio showcases my skills along with this menu that I created on job.
